Articles.Content: So I launched a probe to laythe as a one way lander. And during reeentry I thought to set the semi deployment pressure but instead of making the value lower I made it higher and forgot. I was like WHY ARE YOU NOT DEPLOYING and I reslized why at 300m. The probe went in the drink

Well, it happens quite a number of times to all of us.

Like in a game where I had Antenna Range and the "Require Link for Probe Control" setting on, the time the unmanned craft I had, had the antenna installed on the stage disposed prior to reentry, so when I tried to pop the chutes, they wouldn't go, and I was wondering why they wouldn't all the way down until I checked the AR icon. Not the last time that happened, either. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
went to do a Mun landing, sent my crew into orbit around the sun and out of fuel... um...oops?

@Sampa: HOW. xD

I had this exact problem with a Duna probe landing.

> 
> @Sampa: HOW. xD
> I had this exact problem with a Duna probe landing.

I went to try and adjust my orbit to make the landing easier, but I was a bit dumb and forgot to actually turn the vehicle around and instead burn my orbit out into Kerbol orbit!
